publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1937# Cathy Jamieson: Adult Learners' Week—That the Parliament recognises Adult Learners’ Week between 12 and 18 May 2001; supports the goal of making lifelong learning a central theme of working life; commends the work done by the trade union movement in promoting learning and training opportunities in the workplace, and asks the Scottish Executive to continue with its work in creating a culture of lifelong learning among the people of Scotland.
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Janis Hughes*, Scott Barrie*, Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1937# Cathy Jamieson: Adult Learners' Week—That the Parliament recognises Adult Learners’ Week between 12 and 18 May 2001; supports the goal of making lifelong learning a central theme of working life; commends the work done by the trade union movement in promoting learning and training opportunities in the workplace, and asks the Scottish Executive to continue with its work in creating a culture of lifelong learning among the people of Scotland. Supported by: Janis Hughes, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Pauline McNeill*, Elaine Thomson*
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Elaine Smith*

S1M-1937# Cathy Jamieson: Adult Learners' Week—That the Parliament recognises Adult Learners’ Week between 12 and 18 May 2001; supports the goal of making lifelong learning a central theme of working life; commends the work done by the trade union movement in promoting learning and training opportunities in the workplace, and asks the Scottish Executive to continue with its work in creating a culture of lifelong learning among the people of Scotland. Supported by: Janis Hughes, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Donald Gorrie, Pauline McNeill, Elaine Thomson, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Margaret Jamieson*

S1M-1937# Cathy Jamieson: Adult Learners' Week—That the Parliament recognises Adult Learners’ Week between 12 and 18 May 2001; supports the goal of making lifelong learning a central theme of working life; commends the work done by the trade union movement in promoting learning and training opportunities in the workplace, and asks the Scottish Executive to continue with its work in creating a culture of lifelong learning among the people of Scotland. Supported by: Janis Hughes, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Donald Gorrie, Pauline McNeill, Elaine Thomson, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman, Irene Oldfather, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Margaret Jamieson
S1M-1937# Adult Learners' Week (lodged on 16 May 2001) Mr Duncan McNeil*

S1M-1937# Cathy Jamieson: Adult Learners' Week—That the Parliament recognises Adult Learners’ Week between 12 and 18 May 2001; supports the goal of making lifelong learning a central theme of working life; commends the work done by the trade union movement in promoting learning and training opportunities in the workplace, and asks the Scottish Executive to continue with its work in creating a culture of lifelong learning among the people of Scotland. Supported by: Janis Hughes, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Donald Gorrie, Pauline McNeill, Elaine Thomson, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman, Irene Oldfather, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Duncan McNeil
